action.action-desc: Ms. Schakowsky introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Consumer Product Safety Act to strike provisions that limit the disclosure of certain information by the Consumer Product Safety Commission.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sunshine in Product Safety Act.

section.header: Disclosure of information on consumer products

subsection.text: Section 6 of the Consumer Product Safety Act (15 U.S.C. 2055) is amended by striking subsection (b).
The Consumer Product Safety Act is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 6A (15 U.S.C. 2055a), by striking and (b) each place that such appears in subsections (b)(3) and (f); and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e)(2)(B), by striking unless with respect to such information the Commission has complied with the applicable requirements of section 6(b); and
in subsection (f)(1), by striking subsections (a)(3) and (b) and inserting subsection (a)(3).
